title: Re-Opening Economy Early Would Be 'Very Serious Error:' Summers
text: Apr.17 -- Lawrence.

title: How the market sell-off may have created the perfect opportunity for activist investors
text: Is now a good time to get active, with Ken Squire, founder 13D Activist Fund.

title: A Stock-Picker’s Market
text: Stocks have been on a tear based on hope. Don’t expect it to last … but do expect truly strong stocks to continue doing well   Yesterday evening, we received wonderfully encouraging news.

title: 'It's Chaos out there': Kevin O'Leary on post-coronavirus path for businesses
text: Kevin O'Leary, chairman of O'Shares and star of 'Shark Tank,' on the path forward for small businesses.

title: Stocks set to pop as the US economy reopens
text: Peloton's down and Planet Fitness is higher as the economy is set to reopen.

title: Wall St. braces for ugly earnings due to coronavirus
text: A look ahead to next week's earnings.

title: Investor Mary Meeker says Covid-19 crisis is separating businesses with strong online strategies from laggards
text: Mary Meeker, who is known for her lengthy annual "Internet Trends" report, says businesses that are doing the best in the current crisis use cloud technologies, sell products that are always needed, can easily be found online, make other businesses more efficient and have a good social media presence.

title: Guggenheim’s Minerd Says Expect a Retracement on S&P 500
text: Scott Minerd, chief investment officer at Guggenheim Partners, explains why the S&P 500 will suffer further declines as he sees the index falling to 1,500 or lower. He speaks with Bloomberg’s Sonali Basak on "Bloomberg Markets: European Close."

title: McConnell, McCarthy pick reps for committee to oversee bailout fund
text: Toomey, Hill and Schumer's pick, Bharat Ramamurti join an oversight team that has already attracted scrutiny, despite the fact it has yet to launch.

title: U.S. bailout watchdog vows to scrutinize share buybacks, dividends
text: An official charged with overseeing how the U.S. government handles $500 billion in bailout funds said on Friday he will also monitor how companies use the cash, including for share buybacks, dividends and staff compensation.

title: Thomas Lee: Investing Trends To Capitalize On As Coronavirus Stock Market Recovers
text: Thomas Lee, Managing Partner and Head of Research at Fundstrat Global Advisors, joined the podcast this week to discuss the potential coronavirus stock market rally and why investors should be long-term greedy for maximum returns.

title: US Indexes Close Higher Friday and for the April 17 Week
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 24,242.49 on Friday with a gain of 704.81 points or 2.99%.

title: Stocks rise after promising coronavirus drug trial results. Here's what to watch
text: U.S. stocks surged Friday. Here's what four market experts believe lies ahead.

title: Banks say Treasury not giving enough guidance on SBA loans: Report
text: FOX Business' Charlie Gasparino says big banks are trying to hand out loans to the best cients on a first-come, first-served basis, but many banks are still worried they could be sued for making loans without due diligence.

title: Donohue: Time to put more money into small business loan program
text: Tom Donohue, CEO of U.S. Chamber of Commerce, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss small business loans.

title: Stocks rally as investors take heart on U.S. economic reopening plan
text: Global stocks rallied on Friday on President Donald Trump's plans to revive the coronavirus-hit U.S. economy and a report about a clinical trial for a potential drug to treat COVID-19, while the dollar fell amid investors' growing risk-on sentiment.

title: Six Numbers That Show How Hard The Travel Industry Is Being Hit By The Coronavirus Shutdown
text: 8 million jobs will be lost in the U.S. alone by the end of April.

title: Stock Market Today: Berkshire’s Munger Opens Up; Sell Apple?
text: We saw equities jump to life in the stock market today, as investors hope for a cure for the coronavirus. Here's what happened on Friday.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Friday (April 17)
text: Stocks jumped after a report said a Gilead Sciences drug showed some effectiveness in treating the coronavirus.

title: Will Texas Force Oil Production Cuts?
text: Thousands of people tuned in as the Texas Railroad Commission heard testimony on a proposal to limit oil production in the state. There was plenty of drama, but the realities of the market suggest production cuts in one state – even a state as oil-rich as Texas – won’t work.

title: Dow ends more than 700 points higher as stocks log second week of gains
text: Stocks ended with strong gains Friday, cementing a positive week, as investors appeared to take comfort in a report that a COVID-19 treatment showed promise and the White House outlined a plan to begin reopening parts of the economy.

title: Cantor Fitzgerald to Cut Hundreds of Jobs in Break From Wall Street
text: Cantor Fitzgerald is shrinking its workforce, breaking with firms across Wall Street that vowed not to lay off employees during a pandemic that’s unleashed the worst unemployment crisis in decades. Bloomberg's Sridhar Natarajan reports on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Nuveen's Doll Says Clarity in Market Is 'Close to Zero'
text: Robert Doll, Nuveen's chief equity strategist, says it's hard for investors to get clarity in markets right now.

title: BofA's Savita Subramanian: Best time to pick stocks
text: Savita Subramanian, Bank of America head of U.S. equity and quantitative strategy, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss how she's watching the market as the market volatility continues.

title: There are pockets in energy and tech: RBC Capital Markets M&A co-head
text: Vito Sperduto, RBC Capital Markets co-head of global M&A, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss the state of the markets and what's he's watching.

title: A blast of earnings news is coming, but the market may be more focused on when the economy will reopen
text: Coca-cola, Netflix and dozens more report earnings, but markets will look more for news on reopening the economy in the week ahead.

title: Global stocks rally as investors take heart on U.S. economic reopening plan
text: Global stocks rallied on Friday on President Donald Trump's plans to revive the coronavirus-hit U.S. economy and hopes of a potential drug to treat COVID-19, while the dollar fell amid investors' growing risk-on sentiment.

title: 'Most jobs will come back... but it will be very slow for certain industries,' :Philadelphia Fed
text: Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker joins Yahoo Finance’s On The Move to discuss the Fed's response to the coronavirus crisis and Pennsylvania’s plans on reopening the economy.

title: Here's a breakdown of who actually got SBA PPP loans
text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports that the SBA approved 1.66M PPP loans worth about $342 billion.

title: Retailers, restaurants, hotels get 18% of small business bailout cash: SBA
text: Retailers, restaurants and hotels -- on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic -- got a combined 18% of the $342 billion allocated as of Thursday under the a new federal government program to help small firms keep paying their employees during widespread shutdown, data from the agency running the program showed on Friday.

title: U.S. oil futures settle at lowest since early 2002, down nearly 20% for the week
text: U.S. benchmark oil futures dropped Friday to mark another finish at their lowest in more than 18 years, tallying a loss of 20% for the week.

title: Here's how Raymond James' CIO sees a return to S&P 3000
text: Larry Adam, Raymond James CIO, and Ron Insana, Schroders senior advisor, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the state of the market after promising results of Gilead coronavirus drug trial.

title: Earnings Expectations Are Driving the Market’s Rebound
text:
Bullish price action in the April markets might leave some scratching their heads, but investors are simply doing what they've always done: trading on future cash flows rather than present ones.
The post Earnings Expectations Are Driving the Market’s Rebound appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: New York Fed says it will halve next week's government bond purchases
text: The New York Fed said it would cut its Treasury purchases by half to $75 billion next week, from $150 billion this week.

title: China A-Shares: 6 Reasons Why Investors Should Consider Them
text: It's not just about a Chinese recovery.

title: Leading economic indicators decline 6.7% in March, vs. 7.2% drop expected
text: CNBC's Rick Santelli reports on the latest round of economic data amid the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Why Anthony Scaramucci says not to sell stocks during a pandemic
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" is joined by Anthony Scaramucci of SkyBridge Capital to discuss his outlook for markets amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stocks are soaring on a potential coronavirus treatment. But the excitement may be premature
text: Investors around the world are fired up by signs that an experimental drug made by Gilead Sciences is helping some coronavirus patients rapidly recover.

title: Gold futures post losses for the session and week
text: Gold futures fell on Friday to post a loss of about 3% for the week. Optimism over a drug that shows potential to treat COVID-19 and the release of a plan to gradually reopen the U.S.

title: Very skeptical that we've seen the worst of what's coming: Josh Brown
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" discusses their outlook for markets amid the coronavirus pandemic after Gilead reports success with a medicine to treat the illness.

title: Minerd Sees a ‘Long Haul’ to Get Unemployment Back Where It Was
text: Scott Minerd, chief investment officer at Guggenheim Partners, discusses the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stock Rally Isn’t in Sectors That Spark the Economy: Canaccord’s Dwyer
text: Betting against the guys printing the money makes no sense, says Tony Dwyer, chief market strategist at Canaccord Genuity.

title: Is Now a Good Time to Invest?
text: Yes, stocks are "on sale" now, and for some investors, now is an ideal time to ramp up their portfolios.

title: Don’t Chase Gold Prices
text: The gold futures and SPDR Gold Trust (GLD) have had a good run to the upside but there were signs to take partial profits this week. Where should prices find support?

title: JPM’s Bilton Is ‘Still a Little Bit Nervous’ About This Market
text: This looks “a little bit more like a bear market rally,” says John Bilton, head of global multi-asset strategy at JPMorgan Asset Management.

title: Stock Market Gains Overstating Health of the Rally
text:
Key Stock Market Rally Takeaways: – Ongoing volatility reduces value of price signals – Mega-caps lead but other areas not following – Time needed to build base of support for sustainable uptrend At times gauging the health of a rally might be as straightforward as looking at price trends. The S&P 500 fell 34% from […]
The post Stock Market Gains Overstating Health of the Rally appeared first on See It Market.

title: Santelli Exchange: Hormats on markets and reopening the economy
text: Tiedemann Advisors' Robert Hormat and CNBC's Rick Santelli discuss supply chains and strategic reserves.

title: Baker Hughes reports a weekly drop of 66 in the U.S. oil-rig count
text: Baker Hughes BKR, +2.70% on Thursday reported that the number of active U.S. rigs drilling for oil dropped by 66 to 438 this week.

title: Investment advisor talks hope for the economy, new highs for the market and stocks to consider
text: Heritage Capital President and CIO Paul Schatz discusses why he is hopeful the economy will come back and why he optimistic about the stock market.

title: NYSE and Nasdaq challenger MEMX delays launch due to coronavirus crisis
text: The Members Exchange (MEMX), a new bourse backed by major Wall Street firms looking to take on the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc  through lower fees, said on Friday it delayed its planned launch date due to the coronavirus crisis.
